title: What's the difference between Wi-Fi and Wi-Fi Direct? - Quora

response.answer_text: Well I believe I do not need to answer you on what Wi-Fi is, rather I’ll give you definition about Wi-Fi Direct: It allows two devices to establish a direct Wi-Fi connection without requiring a wireless router. Hence, Wi-Fi Direct is **single radio hop communication**, not multihop wireless communication, unlike wireless ad hoc networks and mobile ad hoc networks. Wi-Fi ad hoc mode, however, supports multi-hop radio communications, with intermediate Wi-Fi nodes as packet relays. So roughly.. WiFi can be used by many devices at the same time connected to the same access point. While WiFi-Direct is just a communication between two devices and that’s it.

Wifi generally is used to connect you to a network and/or the internet. Wifi Direct is used specifically for device to device connections, bypassing network. Examples I know about using wifi direct in my home are: Printing directly from my cell phone to my wifi enabled printer.My Roku 3 remote control is connected to the streaming device via wifi direct.I can copy files between my cell and my desktop machine quickly using an app that makes a wifi direct connection.
